assessments.assessment_description: FDA approved sleep monitoring device that provides detailed sleep quality analysis including deep sleep, REM sleep, and overall sleep quality metrics. Worn nightly for approximately two weeks to establish baseline and measure intervention effects.

Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry scan used to measure body composition including visceral fat distribution and subcutaneous fat changes, particularly for monitoring peptide interventions like tesamorelin.
Continuous blood pressure measurement over 24 hours to assess cardiovascular health and monitor effects of metabolic peptide interventions.
Real-time glucose monitoring device used to track metabolic responses and glucose metabolism improvements during peptide interventions.
Blood test measuring liver enzymes to monitor improvements in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease and metabolic liver health during peptide therapy.
Continuous monitoring of heart rate variability, resting heart rate, breathing rate, and skin temperature using wearable devices to detect illness onset and monitor general health status.

interventions.intervention_description: FDA-approved peptide for HIV-associated lipodystrophy that reduces visceral fat and improves cardiometabolic status through targeted body composition changes
Peptides including sermorelin, CJC1295, and ipamorelin that stimulate growth hormone release to improve sleep, recovery, and body composition
Sleep-specific peptide intervention monitored with FDA-approved sleep devices to improve sleep quality and duration
Regenerative peptide for gut healing, anti-inflammatory effects, and post-workout recovery, though with limited human data
Peptides that enhance energy utilization, glucose metabolism, and decrease inflammatory markers for general well-being improvement
Strategic combination of different peptides aligned with seasonal body rhythms - immune modulators in fall, mitochondrial optimization in winter, growth hormone secretagogues in spring

assessments.assessment_description: Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry scan used to measure body composition, specifically tracking visceral fat levels and muscle mass changes in response to peptide therapy
Assessment of sleep parameters using wearable devices to track sleep optimization, particularly deep sleep and slow-wave sleep enhancement from growth hormone-related peptides

interventions.intervention_description: A peptide used for 20 days during resistance training to enhance recovery, treat musculoskeletal injuries, gastrointestinal disorders, and post-surgical repair. Works by enhancing angiogenesis, modulating VEGF, and reducing inflammatory cytokines.
A peptide used for wound healing, post-surgical recovery, and long COVID recovery. Promotes angiogenesis, reduces fibrosis and scarring, and helps with stem cell recruitment and activation.

A peptide used for chronic viral infections, vaccine response enhancement, and immune therapy protocols. Reduces pro-inflammatory cytokines and improves age-related immune decline. Recommended timing is August-October before flu and COVID vaccines.

A growth hormone releasing hormone analog used for body composition optimization, age-related growth hormone decline, and sleep quality enhancement. Specifically enhances deep slow-wave sleep and promotes lean muscle development while supporting fat breakdown.

A growth hormone releasing peptide that stimulates natural growth hormone production. Used for growth hormone optimization, body composition improvement, and sleep quality enhancement. Taken at bedtime due to appetite stimulation effects.

A growth hormone releasing hormone used for sleep quality improvement and body composition optimization. Previously FDA approved and commonly prescribed. Should be cycled (2-3 months on, 1-2 months off) to prevent receptor desensitization.

An FDA-approved peptide for HIV-associated lipodystrophy, used off-label for visceral fat reduction and body composition redistribution. Also helps with brain fog and cognitive function while enhancing collagen synthesis.

A peptide used topically for skin aging, photoaging repair, and hair loss. Stimulates collagen production and has anti-inflammatory properties. Used for wrinkles, firmness, texture, scar improvement, and wound healing.

An oral peptide used for intestinal inflammation and repair in conditions like leaky gut, SIBO, chronic bloating, and IBD. Anti-inflammatory at the gut lining and often combined with BPC-157 for gut reset protocols.

A mitochondrial-targeted peptide recently FDA approved for Barth syndrome. Used for mitochondrial enhancement, restoring ATP production, improving energy levels, and helping with cardiovascular disease and heart failure.
An FDA-approved peptide (brand name Vyleesi) used for hypoactive sexual desire disorder to enhance sexual desire and function.
A combination peptide protocol using BPC-157 and Thymosin Beta-4 together synergistically for enhanced tissue repair and recovery.

A strategic approach to peptide use based on seasonal timing: Winter for repair and conservation, Spring for anabolic and regeneration, Summer for maintenance and immune optimization, and Autumn for preparation and metabolic priming.
A 20-day protocol combining resistance training with BPC-157 peptide therapy to enhance recovery and tissue repair during intensive training periods.

Include timing protocols (bedtime administration, cycling schedules, seasonal timing) and administration routes (subcutaneous, oral, topical)
Add biochemical markers mentioned (IGF-1, VEGF receptors, growth hormone receptors) and expand monitoring technologies
Systematically capture contraindications, drug interactions, and safety monitoring requirements across all peptide classes

practitioner_domains.domain_description: The balance between energy intake and energy expenditure, focusing on consistently consuming approximately the number of calories being expended over time
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Can be modified for specific goals like weight loss (negative energy balance), muscle gain (positive energy balance), or maintenance (balanced state). Requires assessment of both energy intake and expenditure sides of the equation.

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Comprehensive evaluation of dietary intake patterns, macronutrient distribution, and nutritional adequacy
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Involves 24-hour dietary recalls, photo documentation, and calculation of energy and macronutrient intake. Accounts for typical 20% under-reporting in self-reported intake.

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Measurement and evaluation of energy expenditure through various testing methods
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Includes resting metabolic rate testing, doubly labeled water studies, and wearable technology data interpretation with understanding of accuracy limitations.

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: The relationship between energy intake and energy expenditure, measured as the difference between calories consumed and calories burned
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Primary construct being assessed through combination of intake and expenditure measurements

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: The number of calories burned at rest, measured through metabolic cart testing with gas exchange analysis
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Measured via 30-60 minute metabolic cart test in fasted, rested state. Used as baseline for calculating total energy expenditure with activity factors.

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Total calories burned through basal metabolism, physical activity, and thermogenesis
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Assessed through doubly labeled water (gold standard), RMR testing with activity factors, or wearable devices (least accurate, up to 50% error)

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Total calories consumed through food and beverages, typically under-reported by approximately 20%
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Assessed through 24-hour dietary recalls, photo documentation, and dietitian analysis. Requires deep dive into portions, brands, and daily variations.

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Metabolic state where RMR is 10% or more below predicted values, indicating body's adaptation to conserve energy
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Identified when measured RMR is significantly lower than equation-predicted values, suggesting inadequate energy intake relative to expenditure

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: The ratio and absolute amounts of protein, carbohydrates, and fats in the diet relative to goals and activity demands
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Calculated from dietary intake data and adjusted based on specific goals (e.g., protein for muscle maintenance, carbohydrates for endurance performance)

sport_specificity.assessment_modifications: Higher emphasis on carbohydrate intake assessment and energy expenditure during prolonged activities
sport_specificity.intervention_modifications: Priority on carbohydrate adequacy over protein when addressing energy gaps, specific activity factors for endurance training

sport_specificity.assessment_modifications: Use of doubly labeled water during typical training blocks, separate assessment for game days vs. practice days vs. off days
sport_specificity.intervention_modifications: Faster timeline for interventions, especially during injury recovery. Higher energy needs requiring multiple intervention steps.

sport_specificity.assessment_modifications: Assessment during training phases with high volume and intensity
sport_specificity.intervention_modifications: Accelerated timeline for energy balance corrections to support training adaptations and performance goals

assessments.assessment_name: Resting Metabolic Rate (RMR) Testing with Metabolic Cart
assessments.assessment_description: A test where the individual lies down with a hood over their head for 30-60 minutes while a metabolic cart measures gas exchanges to determine baseline energy expenditure. Requires 12-hour fasting, no physical activity before testing, and complete rest during measurement.

A non-invasive test where individuals drink special water and provide urine samples over multiple days to accurately measure total energy expenditure during normal daily activities. Provides average energy expenditure data over the testing period.

A comprehensive interview conducted by a registered dietitian to assess all food and beverage intake from waking to sleeping, including portions, brands, and preparation methods. Used to estimate total energy intake and macronutrient distribution.

Collection of photographs of all meals, snacks, and beverages consumed over 1-3 days, used in conjunction with dietary recall to verify portions and preparation styles for more accurate energy intake estimation.

Use of consumer wearable devices (such as Apple Watch) to track energy expenditure trends over time. While accuracy can be up to 50% off, useful for identifying patterns and relative changes within individuals using the same technology.

interventions.intervention_description: A structured approach to address energy balance by identifying the gap between energy intake and expenditure, then implementing 1-3 targeted changes to close this gap. The intervention is individualized based on the size of the gap, with smaller gaps (300 calories) addressed through simple additions like snacks, while larger gaps (1000+ calories) require multiple progressive steps building habits over time.

A goal-specific intervention that adjusts macronutrient distribution to support individual objectives. For fat loss with muscle maintenance, protein is prioritized to meet thresholds, carbohydrates are calculated based on activity level, and fats are set at 20-35% of total calories. Changes are implemented progressively, such as adding protein sources to meals first, then incorporating protein snacks once initial changes become habitual.

A structured approach to create an appropriate energy deficit of 200-500 calories for fat loss goals while maintaining adequate nutrition. The intervention ensures protein thresholds are met, carbohydrate needs are addressed based on activity level, and the deficit is created in a sustainable manner that supports the individual's training and recovery needs.

A comprehensive approach where nutrition interventions are designed to support and complement other concurrent interventions (exercise, sleep, stress management, medical treatments). Nutrition recommendations are developed after understanding all other interventions in place, ensuring the nutrition plan serves and enhances the effectiveness of the overall treatment approach.

construct_relationships.relationship_description: Energy intake is one half of the energy balance equation - when consistently matched with energy expenditure over time, it creates energy balance
construct_relationships.evidence_mentioned: Energy balance is when you are consistently over time consuming just about the number of calories that you are expending

construct_relationships.relationship_description: Energy expenditure is the other half of the energy balance equation - must be matched with energy intake to achieve balance
construct_relationships.evidence_mentioned: Looking at energy intake, energy expenditure, and trying to bring those closer together

construct_relationships.relationship_description: RMR is the baseline component of total energy expenditure, which can be multiplied by activity factors to estimate total expenditure
construct_relationships.evidence_mentioned: We can use activity factors to multiply against your resting metabolic rate to understand what your overall energy expenditure would be

construct_relationships.relationship_description: Low energy availability causes the body to reduce resting metabolic rate as an adaptive response to conserve energy
construct_relationships.evidence_mentioned: If resting metabolic rate is measured at 10% less than estimation, that is typically a marker of low energy availability state where your body is pulling back on metabolic rate to conserve energy

construct_relationships.relationship_description: All calories come from macronutrients, so macronutrient distribution determines the composition and quality of energy intake
construct_relationships.evidence_mentioned: All of our calories are coming from macronutrients. So what are the macronutrients that we're really specifically not getting enough of relative to the goal

detailed_steps: Schedule test for morning hours in fasted state

Have client lie down in comfortable position
Place metabolic hood over client's head
Initiate gas exchange measurement for 30-60 minutes
Monitor for complete stillness and relaxation throughout test
Record continuous gas exchange data
Calculate RMR from oxygen consumption and CO2 production

Arrive in rested state
Avoid heart rate elevation before test

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: LDL molecule bound to ApoB molecule, most dangerous cardiovascular lipoprotein associated with atherosclerotic plaque formation

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Ratio indicating proportion of dangerous cholesterol (LDL) relative to total cholesterol

assessments.assessment_description: Comprehensive blood test that measures various cholesterol and lipid markers to assess cardiovascular risk, requiring 12-hour fasting and typical meal consumption the night before
Blood test that measures lipoprotein-associated phospholipase A2 activity to assess inflammation and potential plaque formation in blood vessels
Whole blood test that measures EPA, DHA, and DPA fatty acid levels to assess omega-3 status and the ratio of saturated to anti-inflammatory fats
Combined blood test measuring both fasting glucose and fasting insulin levels to assess glucose tolerance, insulin sensitivity, and risk of type 2 diabetes, requiring 12-hour fasting
Blood test measuring creatinine levels to assess kidney filtration function, which can be affected by muscle turnover, dehydration, and exercise timing

interventions.intervention_description: Reduce saturated fat intake to less than 20 grams per day to improve the liver's ability to package fats into HDL molecules rather than LDL molecules
Increase fish oil intake to greater than 3,000 mg per day, preferably in liquid form rather than capsules for better absorption
Take 2 capsules of Inflam Control containing serrapeptidase (10,000 international units) taken 30 minutes away from food to break down plaques and reduce inflammatory markers
Take glucose control supplement containing berberine (500 mg with each meal) and chromium picolinate (1 mg three times daily) for blood sugar regulation and insulin sensitivity
Increase hydration and reduce exercise prior to blood testing to address elevated creatinine levels potentially caused by dehydration or muscle turnover
Use powerful antioxidants including vitamin A, C, E, zinc, selenium, and aloe vera capsules to support kidney function when creatinine levels are elevated
Have a typical dinner the night before testing and fast for 12 hours before blood draw, avoiding high saturated fat meals that could impact cholesterol test results
